IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: NUARI'S MISSION IS A) TO SERVE THE NATIONAL PUBLIC INTEREST THROUGH THE STUDY OF CRITICAL NATIONAL ISSUES; B) TO PROVIDE RAPID RESEARCH, DEVELOPMENT AND DEPLOYMENT OF NEEDED TECHNOLOGY SOLUTIONS; C) TO ADDRESS RELATED CRITICAL POLICY, INFORMATION MANAGEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY ISSUES TO ENHANCE NATIONAL RESPONSE CAPABILITY; D) TO DEVELOP RELATED EDUCATIONAL AND TRAINING PROGRAMS; AND E) TO SERVE AS A NATIONAL EDUCATION CENTER FOR COUNTER-TERRORISM AND CYBERCRIME.
IRS990.MissionDesc: NUARI'S MISSION IS A) TO SERVE THE NATIONAL PUBLIC INTEREST THROUGH THE STUDY OF CRITICAL NATIONAL ISSUES; B) TO PROVIDE RAPID RESEARCH, DEVELOPMENT AND DEPLOYMENT OF NEEDED TECHNOLOGY SOLUTIONS; C) TO ADDRESS RELATED CRITICAL POLICY, INFORMATION MANAGEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY ISSUES TO ENHANCE NATIONAL RESPONSE CAPABILITY; D) TO DEVELOP RELATED EDUCATIONAL AND TRAINING PROGRAMS; AND E) TO SERVE AS A NATIONAL EDUCATION CENTER FOR COUNTER-TERRORISM AND CYBERCRIME.
IRS990.Desc: TRAINING, EXERCISE AND SIMULATION ACTIVITIES: (A) CYBER EXERCISE SUPP. EXERCISES - SCENERIOS AND EXERCISES USING THE DECIDE FS TOOL TO DEMONSTRATE EFFECTIVENESS AND NEED FOR CYBER INCIDENT RESPONSE PLANS IN THE FINANCIAL SECTOR (B) CYBER INTRUSION PLANNING AND DETECTION FOR THE STATE OF VT (C)CYBER EDUCATION TRAINING.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: COURSEWARE DEVELOPMENT AND DESIGN ACTIVITIES: DEVELOP WEB BASED INCIDENT RESPONSE TRAINING FOR STATES AND COMMUNITITES WHICH WILL ENHANCE THEIR RESPONSE CAPABILITIES AND PREPARDEDNESS IN THE EVENT OF A CYBER ATTACK, NATIONAL EMERGENCY OR OTHER DISASTER.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES: PROVIDED SME SUPPORT AND PROGRAM MANAGEMENT FOR VISUAL AUGMENTATION SYSTEMS AND OTHER RELATED DEFENSE TECHNOLOGY PROGRAMS; DEVELOP EDUCATIONAL INNOVATION THROUGH SME SUPPORT AND PROGRAM MANAGEMENT, AND PROVIDE OTHER SPECIALIZED TECHNICAL SERVICES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NUARI IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION AS DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501 (C) (3) OF THE U.S. INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND IS GENERALLY EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 509 (A) (2) OF THE CODE. NUARI BELIEVES IT HAS TAKEN NO SIGNIFICANT UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE J, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PREVIOUSLY APPROVED A CHANGE TO ITS ORIGINAL EXPENSE REIMBURSEMENT POLICY WHICH ALLOWS DIRECTORS TO TRAVEL AT THE NEXT HIGHER AVAILABLE AIRFARE CLASS WHEN A SCHEDULED FLIGHT SEGMENT IS IN EXCESS OF TWO HOURS. THE DIRECTOR MUST SUBMIT A PRINTOUT FOR BOTH THE COACH FARE AS WELL AS A RECIEPT FOR THE HIGHER FARE FOR THE SAME ITINERARY AND DATE OF TRAVEL. DIRECTOR MARK ANARUMO IS REQUIRED BY NORWICH UNIVERSITY, TO LIVE IN A HOUSE PROVIDED BY THE UNIVERSITY AS A CONDITION OF HIS EMPLOYMENT AND FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF THE EMPLOYER. THE VALUE OF HIS 2022 HOUSING IN THE AMOUNT OF 54,660 IS INCLUDED IN NUARI'S FORM 990. SCHJ, PART (D) AS PART OF HIS NONTAXABLE BENEFITS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE J, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 4
SCHEDULE J, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 7
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE UNIVERSITY AND NUARI MAY AWARD BONUSES IN CERTAIN CIRCUMSTANCES TO REWARD EFFORT AND PERFORMANCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE J, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 8
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DIRECTOR MARK ANARUMO ENTERED INTO AN INITIAL CONTRACT WITH THE UNIVERSITY EFFECTIVE JUNE 1, 2020 THROUGH MAY 31, 2023.

NUARI'S MISSION IS A) TO SERVE THE NATIONAL PUBLIC INTEREST THROUGH THE STUDY OF CRITICAL NATIONAL ISSUES; B) TO PROVIDE RAPID RESEARCH, DEVELOPMENT AND DEPLOYMENT OF NEEDED TECHNOLOGY SOLUTIONS; C) TO ADDRESS RELATED CRITICAL POLICY, INFORMATION MANAGEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY ISSUES TO ENHANCE NATIONAL RESPONSE CAPABILITY; D) TO DEVELOP RELATED EDUCATIONAL AND TRAINING PROGRAMS; AND E) TO SERVE AS A NATIONAL EDUCATION CENTER FOR COUNTER-TERRORISM AND CYBERCRIME.
MEMBERS OF THE ORGANIZATIONS BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE APPOINTED BY THE NORWICH UNIVERSITY BOARD OF TRUSTEES

APPROVAL BY THE MAJORITY OF THE NORWICH UNIVERSITY BOARD OF TRUSTEES IS ONLY REQUIRED FOR THE APPOINTMENT (INCLUDING THE FILLING OF A VACANT BOARD POSITION), AND/OR REMOVAL OF DIRECTORS OF THE ORGANIZATION.
THE AUDIT COMMITTEE IS CHARGED WITH THE RESPONSIBILITY FOR REVIEWING AND APPROVING THE ANNUAL TAX RETURN PRIOR TO ITS SUBMISSION.

ALL BOARD DIRECTORS, OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO READ THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND TO SIGN AN ANNUAL STATEMENT DISCLOSING ANY REAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. SIGNED STATEMENTS ARE SUBMITTED TO THE BOARD SECRETARY AND SUMMARIZED FOR THE ENTIRE BOARD. IN THE EVENT THE SECRETARY PERCEIVES A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST, THE MATTER IS REFERRED TO THE BOARD FOR FURTHER REVIEW AND A DETERMINATION AS TO HOW TO PROCEED. ANY FURTHER PROCEDURES ARE THEN DOCUMENTED IN THE BOARD MINUTES.

THE ORGANIZATION OBTAINS SALARY COMPARABILITY DATA FOR ITS DIRECTORS, OFFICER, AND KEY EMPLOYESS; THIS INFORMATION IS THEN REVIEWED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S COMPENSATION COMITTEE IN DETERMINING APPROPRIATE COMPENSATION FOR THOSE INDIVIDUALS.

THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ALL ORGANIZATIONAL DOCUMENTS, INCLUDING ITS FORM 1023, ANNUAL TAX RETURNS, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION UPON REQUEST.
